pullRequest.title: SQL DB Lock Exception added and IAM Cache Clean
pullRequest.bodyText:
IAM data will pile up on devices and down the road this could become an issue

Includes cleaning impressions, clicks, dismissals and SQL data for IAMs


Db lock issue was present during opening db retries, related to #988

Added an extra exception to go along with SQLiteCantOpenDatabaseException, SQLiteDatabaseLockedException


Replaced all getWritableDatabase and getReadableDatabase with getSQLiteDatabase
Replaced all getWritableDatabase and getReadableDatabase with getSQLiteDatabaseWithRetries



This change is

commit.message:
* IAM data will pile up on devices and down the road this could become an issue
  * Includes cleaning impressions, clicks, dismissals and SQL data for IAMs
* Db lock issue was present during opening db retries, related to #988
  * Added an extra exception to go along with SQLiteCantOpenDatabaseException, SQLiteDatabaseLockedException
* Replaced all `getWritableDatabase` and `getReadableDatabase` with `getSQLiteDatabase`
* Replaced all `getWritableDatabase` and `getReadableDatabase` with `getSQLiteDatabaseWithRetries`

nodes.bodyText: why are these methods (cleanCachedNotifications and cleanCachedUniqueOutcomeEventNotifications) inside the thread definition?
small optimization, but you can avoid dismissedMessages and impressionedMessages shared preference query if you already know that oldMessageIds is null or empty

commit.message:
Added UnitTest to validate all IAM data is cleaned after 6 months
* Modified how we save IAMs so we can keep track of all IAMs in SQL and not just redisplays
  * Now we can delete all IAMs after 6 months easily
  * Now we clean dismissal, impression, and click Sets after 6 months also
* Created OSUtil helper for converting a Set.toString into a Set<String>
* Renamed DisplayStats to RedisplayStats so its a little more clear
  * Replaced Integer.MAX_VALUE with 1 so IAMs that are not redisplay will only be shown once and easier to UnitTest
* Refactored UnitTest helper for OneSignalPrefs to TestOneSignalPrefs

Moved methods outside of OneSignalCacheCleaner Threads
* Better run time optimization keeping these methods outside of the Threads they were written in
* Originally done because these methods are "owned" by the parent methods starting the Threads
* Cmmented these methods so we know when and where they should be used

Optimization for when no old IAM data exists
* No need to delete SQL or SharedPref IAM data if there is no old IAM data

nodes.bodyText: Sry I think you already explained me this, but why is always saving redisplay now?
Let's ensure the backend will always send this value for unlimited reshows.
setString should be something like jsonArray instead.
I think you forgot to rename clickIdsArray to something more generic when you moved it to OSUtils.
SIX_MONTHS_IN_SECONDS should be something more descriptive to what is it used for like IAM_MAX_CACHE_SEC
ONE_WEEK_IN_SECONDS should be something more descriptive to what is it used. One week should be a comment instead.
6 months should be a comment instead.

commit.message:
Fixed comments on previous commits in PR
* Renamed global ONE_WEEK_IN_SECONDS & SIX_MONTHS_IN_SECONDS to NOTIFICATION_CACHE_DATA_LIFETIME & IAM_CACHE_DATA_LIFETIME
* Renamed newStringSetFromString to newStringSetFromJSONArray
* Pass in a JSONArray instead of a string to newStringSetFromJSONArray

nodes.bodyText: I did a quick check on the backed, looks like redisplay won't even get sent unless this value is set to 1 is what we want.
This would be cleaner with 2 methods instead of long if blocks.

commit.message:
Broke up Shared Preference cleaning into 2 methods
* First method cleans message ids for dismissed and impressioned iams stored in Shared Prefs after 6 months
* Second method cleans click ids belonging to the iam in Shared Prefs after 6 months
